inclusion.criterion: Participants must be aged 18 to 65 years old who meet the criteria for schizophrenia diagnosed by Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-fifth edition (DSM-5) or International Classification of Diseases-tenth edition (ICD-10);
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants are in current episode of psychotic symptoms with a disease course less than 3 years and intermission less than 6 months;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: There is at least 1 guardian to accompany patient within 1 year;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants and their guardians must sign an Informed Consent Form (ICF) indicating that they understand the purpose of and procedures required for the study and are willing to participate in the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Meet the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM-V) diagnostic criteria for schizophrenia;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Duration of illness less than 3 years with current symptoms exacerbation;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Male and female with aged 17 to 65 years;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Signed the study consent for participation;
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Participants with known or suspected clinically unstable systemic medical disorder;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Participant has a current or prior DSM-5/ICD-10 diagnosis of substance use disorder, intellectual disability, autism spectrum disorder, dementia or severe cognitive impairment;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Planning to be pregnant, pregnancy or breast-feeding;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Currently enrolled in another clinical trial.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 3-day-old Asian female infant presenting with jaundice. She was born at 38w3d of gestation, after an uncomplicated pregnancy. The family history is unremarkable. The baby is breastfed.
